page.title: 07LOCAL LEGENDS
page.content: The{Blackbird Inn}which is opposite to the{Church}used to be a{Pele Tower}but is now a pub. When the Scottish Raiders came down to raid Newcastle they passed through Ponteland and raided it. There was a{tunnel}under- ground to the Church because they thought it was holy ground and that God would protect them. The tunnel is supposed to still be there,but has not be found. If you go inside you will see battering marks on the door where the Scots tried to get in to the Pele Tower. There is also supposed to be a ghost of a{Victorian}boy in the pub. In remembrance of a drought many years ago a wheelbarrow race is held on New Years Day,starting at the Blackbird and following a circular route. The person in the barrow symbolising the food and water brought back during the drought.
